channel.title: Kosuke Takahashi, Ph.D.
channel.description: Recent content on Kosuke Takahashi, Ph.D.

item.title: About
item.description: (2016.02.26 at Rome) Education Doctor’s degree in Informatics at Kyoto University, Japan, 2016-2018 Supervisor; Prof. Shohei Nobuhara. Doctor thesis; “Camera Calibration Based on Mirror Reflections”. Master’s degree in Informatics at Kyoto University, Japan, 2010-2012 Supervisor; Prof. Takashi Matsuyama. Master thesis; “Mirror-based Camera Pose Estimation Using an Orthogonality Constraint”. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering at Kyoto University, Japan, 2006-2010 Supervisor; Prof. Minoh Michihiko. Bachelor thesis; “Display Visual and Auditory Information to Support Manipulation of Virtual Object in Virtual Studio”.

item.title: Misc
item.description: Invited Talks “AI・sensing technologies contributing to sustainable aquaculture. (持続可能な水産養殖に貢献する AI・センシング技術)”, IIEEJ, Oct, 2022 “Toward realizing IoT・AI device available 365 days in an offshore aquaculture environment. (海上養殖環境で 365 日稼働する IoT・AI デバイスの実現に向けて)”, IEICE Society Conference, Sep, 2022 “Aquaculture x IoT and AI; Technologies for sustainable aquaculture (水産養殖 x IoT・AI ～ 持続可能な水産養殖を実現するセンシング/解析技術 ～)”, SSII, Jun, 2021, slide share (in Japanese) “Applications of Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Technologies in Aquaculture (水産養殖業における CV・パターン認識技術の最前線)”, CVIM/PRMU, Mar, 2021 “Camera calibration ~ foundation and application ~ (実践カメラキャリブレーション ～カメラを用いた実世界計測の基礎と応用～)”, SSII, 2019, slide share (in Japanese) “The Latest Trends of Sports Video Analysis (スポーツ映像解析の最新動向)”, 映像情報メディア学会, Aug, 2018 Awards International CVPR 2012, Best Open source Code Award Second Prize, for “A New Mirror-based Extrinsic Camera Calibration Using an Orthogonality Constraint”.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Book Hideo Saito, Ryo Yonetani, Kosuke Takahashi, et.al. “コンピュータビジョン ―広がる要素技術と応用― ” (Section 1: Camera calibration), 共立出版, 2018 Article “持続可能な水産養殖を実現する IoT・AI 技術”, OplusE 2021 年 11・12 月号（第 482 号）, 2021 Journal papers Kosuke Takahashi, Shohei Nobuhara, “Structure of Multiple Mirror System From Kaleidoscopic Projections of Single 3D Point” IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence (TPAMI). IEEE Xplore, axXiv. Siqi Sun, Kosuke Takahashi, Dan Mikami, Mariko Isogawa, Yoshinori Kusachi, “Multi-view video synchronization using motion rhythms of human joints”, ITE Transactions on Media Technology and Applications, Vol.

item.title: 1: 3D vision
item.description: The 3D vision is one of the most major research fields in computer vision. I’m mainly interested in 3D reconstruction using multi-view geometry and camera calibration for the catadioptric capture system.

item.title: 1. ARTICLE
item.description: I contoributed an article entitled “IoT・AI technologies contributing to sustainable aquaculture. 持続可能な水産養殖を実現する IoT・AI 技術” to a magazine of OplusE.

item.title: 2. human analysis
item.description: Appearances of humans include the important information for analyzing the human, e.g. what they think, how they move, and so on. I’m interested in analyzing them using computer vision techniques.

item.title: 2. INVITED TALK
item.description: I had an invited talk entitled Aquaculture x IoT and AI; Technologies for sustainable aquaculture at organized session in SSII 2021. The presentation material is available from slide share.

item.title: 3. aquaculture
item.description: Enhancing the productivity of aquaculture has a big impact on solving the food problem. Now I’m trying to contribute to this activity using computer vision techniques.

item.title: 3. PAPER
item.description: Our paper entitled Structure of Multiple Mirror System From Kaleidoscopic Projections of Single 3D Point was accepted to IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence (TPAMI) . The paper is available from IEEE Xplore or aXiv.
